item.title: Quick growing large tree, 11th July
item.description:
This tree in the grass outside number 99 Queen Anne Avenue is very tall and growing taller and wider. It is a maple of some kind with no real amenity benefit and is starting to interfere with the telephone wires. It will grow to unmanageable proportions if it is not kept under control . Please consider tree surgery. There are several very untidy trees in this road. It replaced an old cherry blossom tree which also needed pruning at intervals. This is a quick growing species and it will continue to grow unrestrained becoming a hazard for the properties, cars and people in this road even if it does not fall down .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queen Anne Avenue, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing litter bin and food waste/rubbish on the path, 11th July
item.description:
Please could the rubbish be collected and the waste swept up. There are rats seen in the area and so this is a hazard to health. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 244, Kingsground, Middle Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
